# restoreGraphicsState()

**Instance Method**

Removes the context’s graphics state from the top of the graphics state stack and makes the next graphics state the current graphics state.

## Declaration

```swift
func restoreGraphicsState()
```

## Discussion

This method must have been preceded with a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/saveGraphicsState()-swift.method] message to add the graphics state to the stack. Invocations of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/saveGraphicsState()-swift.method] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/restoreGraphicsState()-swift.method] methods may be nested.

Restoring the graphics state restores such attributes as the current drawing style, transformation matrix, color, and font of the original graphics state.

## Managing the Graphics State

- **restoreGraphicsState()**: Pops a graphics context from the per-thread stack, makes it current, and sends the context a restore graphics state message.
- **saveGraphicsState()**: Saves the graphics state of the current graphics context.
- **saveGraphicsState()**: Saves the current graphics state and creates a new graphics state on the top of the stack.
- **setGraphicsState(_:)**: Makes the graphics context of the specified graphics state current, and resets graphics state.
